channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: COVID-19 Detection Using Segmentation, Region Extraction and Classification Pipeline
item.description: Methods The methodology used in the segmentation part is traditional segmentation methods as well as UNet based segmentation.

item.title: Leveraging Instance Features for Label Aggregation in Programmatic Weak Supervision
item.description: In particular, it is built on a mixture of Bayesian label models, each corresponding to a global pattern of correlation, and the coefficients of the mixture components are predicted by a Gaussian Process classifier based on instance features.

item.title: Testing the Number of Components in Finite Mixture Normal Regression Model with Panel Data
item.description: We apply our EM test to estimate the number of production technology types for the finite mixture Cobb-Douglas production function model studied by Kasahara et al. (2022) used the panel data of the Japanese and Chilean manufacturing firms.

item.title: Few-shot Generation of Personalized Neural Surrogates for Cardiac Simulation via Bayesian Meta-Learning
item.description: As test time, metaPNS delivers a personalized neural surrogate by fast feed-forward embedding of a small and flexible number of data available from an individual, achieving -- for the first time -- personalization and surrogate construction for expensive simulations in one end-to-end learning framework.

item.title: Spatial-Temporal Graph Convolutional Gated Recurrent Network for Traffic Forecasting
item.description: We design an attention module to capture long-term dependency by mining periodic information in traffic data.

item.title: Robust Double-Encoder Network for RGB-D Panoptic Segmentation
item.description: We propose a novel encoder-decoder neural network that processes RGB and depth separately through two encoders.

item.title: ARS2: Adaptive Ranking-based Sample Selection for Weakly supervised Class-imbalanced Text Classification
item.description: To obtain a large amount of training labels inexpensively, researchers have recently adopted the weak supervision (WS) paradigm, which leverages labeling rules to synthesize training labels rather than using individual annotations to achieve competitive results for natural language processing (NLP) tasks.

item.title: MechRetro is a chemical-mechanism-driven graph learning framework for interpretable retrosynthesis prediction and pathway planning
item.description: Leveraging artificial intelligence for automatic retrosynthesis speeds up organic pathway planning in digital laboratories.

item.title: VLSNR:Vision-Linguistics Coordination Time Sequence-aware News Recommendation
item.description: In our work, we propose a vision-linguistics coordinate time sequence news recommendation.

item.title: Why Should I Choose You? AutoXAI: A Framework for Selecting and Tuning eXplainable AI Solutions
item.description: In this paper, we propose AutoXAI, a framework that recommends the best XAI solution and its hyperparameters according to specific XAI evaluation metrics while considering the user's context (dataset, ML model, XAI needs and constraints).

item.title: Grape: Knowledge Graph Enhanced Passage Reader for Open-domain Question Answering
item.description: In light of this, we propose a novel knowledge Graph enhanced passage reader, namely Grape, to improve the reader performance for open-domain QA.

item.title: Retrieval of Soft Prompt Enhances Zero-Shot Task Generalization
item.description: During zero-shot inference with language models (LMs), using hard prompts alone may not be able to fully describe the target task.

item.title: A Distributional Lens for Multi-Aspect Controllable Text Generation
item.description: Multi-aspect controllable text generation is a more challenging and practical task than single-aspect control.

item.title: To Softmax, or not to Softmax: that is the question when applying Active Learning for Transformer Models
item.description: Despite achieving state-of-the-art results in nearly all Natural Language Processing applications, fine-tuning Transformer-based language models still requires a significant amount of labeled data to work.

item.title: Improving the Domain Adaptation of Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) Models for Open Domain Question Answering
item.description: We propose \textit{RAG-end2end}, an extension to RAG, that can adapt to a domain-specific knowledge base by updating all components of the external knowledge base during training.

item.title: Explainable Abuse Detection as Intent Classification and Slot Filling
item.description: To proactively offer social media users a safe online experience, there is a need for systems that can detect harmful posts and promptly alert platform moderators.

item.title: Language Models are Multilingual Chain-of-Thought Reasoners
item.description: Finally, we show that the multilingual reasoning abilities of language models extend to other tasks such as commonsense reasoning and word-in-context semantic judgment.

item.title: Learning functional sections in medical conversations: iterative pseudo-labeling and human-in-the-loop approach
item.description: This paper presents an approach that tackles the problem of learning to classify medical dialogue into functional sections without requiring a large number of annotations.

item.title: The Lie Derivative for Measuring Learned Equivariance
item.description: In order to better understand the role of equivariance in recent vision models, we introduce the Lie derivative, a method for measuring equivariance with strong mathematical foundations and minimal hyperparameters.

item.title: Modelling Commonsense Properties using Pre-Trained Bi-Encoders
item.description: Grasping the commonsense properties of everyday concepts is an important prerequisite to language understanding.

item.title: A Review of Uncertainty Calibration in Pretrained Object Detectors
item.description: In the field of deep learning based computer vision, the development of deep object detection has led to unique paradigms (e. g., two-stage or set-based) and architectures (e. g., Faster-RCNN or DETR) which enable outstanding performance on challenging benchmark datasets.

item.title: Mask3D for 3D Semantic Instance Segmentation
item.description: Modern 3D semantic instance segmentation approaches predominantly rely on specialized voting mechanisms followed by carefully designed geometric clustering techniques.

item.title: IR-MCL: Implicit Representation-Based Online Global Localization
item.description: The experiments suggest that the presented implicit representation is able to predict more accurate 2D LiDAR scans leading to an improved observation model for our particle filter-based localization.

item.title: SimPer: Simple Self-Supervised Learning of Periodic Targets
item.description: From human physiology to environmental evolution, important processes in nature often exhibit meaningful and strong periodic or quasi-periodic changes.

item.title: Generative Entity Typing with Curriculum Learning
item.description: To overcome these drawbacks, we propose a novel generative entity typing (GET) paradigm: given a text with an entity mention, the multiple types for the role that the entity plays in the text are generated with a pre-trained language model (PLM).

item.title: Audio-Visual Face Reenactment
item.description: The identity-aware generator takes the source image and the warped motion features as input to generate a high-quality output with fine-grained details.

item.title: Neural Matching Fields: Implicit Representation of Matching Fields for Visual Correspondence
item.description: Existing pipelines of semantic correspondence commonly include extracting high-level semantic features for the invariance against intra-class variations and background clutters.

item.title: Guess the Instruction! Making Language Models Stronger Zero-Shot Learners
item.description: Meta-training, which fine-tunes the language model (LM) on various downstream tasks by maximizing the likelihood of the target label given the task instruction and input instance, has improved the zero-shot task generalization performance.

item.title: Content-Based Search for Deep Generative Models
item.description: The growing proliferation of pretrained generative models has made it infeasible for a user to be fully cognizant of every model in existence.

item.title: Reinforcement Learning with Large Action Spaces for Neural Machine Translation
item.description: Applying Reinforcement learning (RL) following maximum likelihood estimation (MLE) pre-training is a versatile method for enhancing neural machine translation (NMT) performance.

item.title: Rolling Shutter Inversion: Bring Rolling Shutter Images to High Framerate Global Shutter Video
item.description: The RSSR is a very challenging task, and to our knowledge, no practical solution exists to date.

item.title: hyperbox-brain: A Toolbox for Hyperbox-based Machine Learning Algorithms
item.description: hyperbox-brain is an open-source Python library implementing the leading hyperbox-based machine learning algorithms.

item.title: IR2Net: Information Restriction and Information Recovery for Accurate Binary Neural Networks
item.description: In contrast, considering the limited learning ability and information loss caused by the limited representational capability of BNNs, we propose IR$^2$Net to stimulate the potential of BNNs and improve the network accuracy by restricting the input information and recovering the feature information, including: 1) information restriction: for a BNN, by evaluating the learning ability on the input information, discarding some of the information it cannot focus on, and limiting the amount of input information to match its learning ability; 2) information recovery: due to the information loss in forward propagation, the output feature information of the network is not enough to support accurate classification.

item.title: Federated Boosted Decision Trees with Differential Privacy
item.description: There is great demand for scalable, secure, and efficient privacy-preserving machine learning models that can be trained over distributed data.

item.title: The Sound of Silence: Efficiency of First Digit Features in Synthetic Audio Detection
item.description: The recent integration of generative neural strategies and audio processing techniques have fostered the widespread of synthetic speech synthesis or transformation algorithms.

item.title: Melody Infilling with User-Provided Structural Context
item.description: This paper proposes a novel Transformer-based model for music score infilling, to generate a music passage that fills in the gap between given past and future contexts.

item.title: Conditional Feature Importance for Mixed Data
item.description: The CPI enables CFI measurement that controls for any feature dependencies by sampling valid knockoffs - hence, generating synthetic data with similar statistical properties - for the data to be analyzed.

item.title: Joint Entropy Search for Multi-objective Bayesian Optimization
item.description: Many real-world problems can be phrased as a multi-objective optimization problem, where the goal is to identify the best set of compromises between the competing objectives.

item.title: Data Augmentation-free Unsupervised Learning for 3D Point Cloud Understanding
item.description: Unsupervised learning on 3D point clouds has undergone a rapid evolution, especially thanks to data augmentation-based contrastive methods.

item.title: Unsupervised confidence for LiDAR depth maps and applications
item.description: Depth perception is pivotal in many fields, such as robotics and autonomous driving, to name a few.

item.title: CLIP model is an Efficient Continual Learner
item.description: In this work, we show that a frozen CLIP (Contrastive Language-Image Pretraining) model offers astounding continual learning performance without any fine-tuning (zero-shot evaluation).

item.title: Structure Representation Network and Uncertainty Feedback Learning for Dense Non-Uniform Fog Removal
item.description: Few existing image defogging or dehazing methods consider dense and non-uniform particle distributions, which usually happen in smoke, dust and fog.

item.title: Continuous Diagnosis and Prognosis by Controlling the Update Process of Deep Neural Networks
item.description: Continuous diagnosis and prognosis are essential for intensive care patients.

item.title: PSVRF: Learning to restore Pitch-Shifted Voice without reference
item.description: Pitch scaling algorithms have a significant impact on the security of Automatic Speaker Verification (ASV) systems.

item.title: Orthogonal Non-negative Matrix Factorization: a Maximum-Entropy-Principle Approach
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a new methodology to solve the orthogonal non-negative matrix factorization (ONMF) problem, where the objective is to approximate an input data matrix by the product of two non-negative matrices, the features matrix and the mixing matrix, while one of them is orthogonal.

item.title: Augmentor or Filter? Reconsider the Role of Pre-trained Language Model in Text Classification Augmentation
item.description: Our study shows that even employing pre-trained language models, existing text augmentation methods generate numerous low-quality instances and lead to the feature space shift problem in augmentation instances.

item.title: Decanus to Legatus: Synthetic training for 2D-3D human pose lifting
item.description: 3D human pose estimation is a challenging task because of the difficulty to acquire ground-truth data outside of controlled environments.

item.title: Ask Me Anything: A simple strategy for prompting language models
item.description: Prompting is a brittle process wherein small modifications to the prompt can cause large variations in the model predictions, and therefore significant effort is dedicated towards designing a painstakingly "perfect prompt" for a task.

item.title: Unsupervised Sentence Textual Similarity with Compositional Phrase Semantics
item.description: Measuring Sentence Textual Similarity (STS) is a classic task that can be applied to many downstream NLP applications such as text generation and retrieval.

item.title: A Multi-Stage Automated Online Network Data Stream Analytics Framework for IIoT Systems
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel Multi-Stage Automated Network Analytics (MSANA) framework for concept drift adaptation in IIoT systems, consisting of dynamic data pre-processing, the proposed Drift-based Dynamic Feature Selection (DD-FS) method, dynamic model learning & selection, and the proposed Window-based Performance Weighted Probability Averaging Ensemble (W-PWPAE) model.
